title: Is Apache Iceberg the New Hadoop? Navigating the Complexities of Modern Data Lakehouses
subtitle: Conversation with Daniel Palma, Head of Marketing at Estuary
description: Conversation with Daniel Palma, Head of Marketing at Estuary
truncated_body_text: The modern data stack constantly evolves, with new technologies promising to solve age-old problems like scalability, cost, and data silos. Apache Iceberg, an open table format, has recently generated significant buzz. But is it truly revolutionary, or is it destined to repeat the pitfalls of past solutions like Hadoop?

subtitle: An in-depth look at the evolution of Lakehouse implementations, open table formats, and the role of data engineers in the AI era.
description: An in-depth look at the evolution of Lakehouse implementations, open table formats, and the role of data engineers in the AI era.
truncated_body_text: Lakehouse architecture represents a major evolution in data engineering. It combines data lakes' flexibility with data warehouses' structured reliability, providing a unified platform for diverse data workloads ranging from traditional business intelligence to advanced analytics and machine learning.

description: Bridging the Gap Between Kafka, Flink, and the Lakehouse
truncated_body_text: Fluss is a compelling new project in the realm of real-time data processing. I spoke with Jark Wu, who leads the Fluss and Flink SQL team at Alibaba Cloud, to understand its origins and potential. Jark is a key figure in the Apache Flink community, known for his work in building Flink SQL from the ground up and creating Flink CDC and Fluss.

search_engine_title: Data Engineering Weekly #156 - The weekly data, AI & ML newsletter
search_engine_description: Stay ahead in the world of data engineering with 'The Weekly Data Engineering Newsletter.' Our expertly curated newsletter delivers the latest trends, tools, and best practices in data engineering to your inbox. Ideal for data professionals, this newsletter covers everything from big data technologies, ETL frameworks, and data warehousing solutions to the latest industry news. Whether you're an experienced data engineer or just starting, our insights and tips will help you navigate the rapidly evolving data landscape. Subscribe now to join a community committed to cutting-edge data engineering excellence.

title: Data Catalog - A Broken Promise
subtitle: A critique on Data Catalog, and the future of knowledge management
description: A critique on Data Catalog, and the future of knowledge management
truncated_body_text: Data catalogs are the most expensive data integration systems you never intended to build. Data Catalog as a passive web portal to display metadata requires significant rethinking to adopt modern data workflow, not just adding “modern” in its prefix.

title: Data Engineering Weekly #1
subtitle: Weekly data engineering related newsletter
truncated_body_text: I'm passionate about data engineering and decided to start a newsletter to share what I'm learning every week. I hope the newsletter will act as a medium for distributing knowledge and creates healthy conversations. This week's release is an exciting set of articles that focus on data privacy, data discoverability, and data applications.
